techmeme.title: Qualcomm reports Q3 revenue up 11% YoY to $9.39B, vs. $9.21B est., handset chip sales up 12% YoY to $5.9B, and forecasts Q4 revenue above estimates (Ian King/Bloomberg)
Meta reports Q2 revenue up 22% YoY to $39.07B, net income up 73% YoY to $13.47B, and family daily active people up 7% YoY to 3.27B on average for June 2024 (Meta)
Bungie announces it will lay off 220 employees, or 17% of its workforce, and integrate an additional 155 roles into its parent Sony Interactive Entertainment (Wesley Yin-Poole/IGN)
Tether reports "record" net profit of $5.2B in H1 2024, net operating profit of $1.3B in Q2, and US debt holdings of $97.6B, more than countries like Germany (Krisztian Sandor/CoinDesk)
A ransomware attack hits blood donation nonprofit OneBlood, which has asked over 250 hospitals in the US to activate their critical blood shortage protocols (Sean Lyngaas/CNN)
